definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs

sentences.english: Pictures of the counterfeit and authentic products may be viewed on the FDA press release.
sentences.chinese: FDA新闻通稿中有假冒产品和正宗产品的图片。

sentences.english: However, where you can eat authentic donkey to fire it?
sentences.chinese: 但是你在哪里能吃到正宗的驴肉火烧呢？

sentences.english: S. city has at least a half-dozen places where you can find a decent green chicken curry.
sentences.chinese: 今天，任何一个美国大城市能都找到正宗的绿咖喱鸡。

sentences.english: Where do go to eat traditional Beijing snack woollen cloth?
sentences.chinese: 去哪里吃正宗的北京小吃呢？

sentences.english: Only with this can be called the seven characteristics of authentic Mapo tofu.
sentences.chinese: 只有具备了这七大特点才能称得上是正宗的麻婆豆腐。

sentences.english: When we say the authentic literature, one is poetry; do you know what the other one is?
sentences.chinese: 所谓的文学正宗，一个是诗词，另一个是什么？

sentences.english: Promoting products as "authentic" is serious business these days.
sentences.chinese: 把一种食物推为正宗在当今是件严肃的事情。

sentences.english: His restaurant has two storeys , sells orthodox western-style food, and most famous as its Pizza.
sentences.chinese: 小店分上下两层，专营正宗西餐，尤以比萨最出名。

sentences.english: You know that spicy rice noodles are the right way to breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 你知道麻辣粉才是最正宗的早餐。

sentences.english: You do not need to look elsewhere in Surabaya for a Chinese flavor.
sentences.chinese: 这么正宗的中国菜，在泗水您找不到第二家了。

sentences.english: In Yantai, you must taste some authentic flavor of the original styles of AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 在烟台，您一定要品尝一下正宗的原滋原味的鲁菜。

sentences.english: How are we going to pass the authentic BJ spirit one generation after another to the children?
sentences.chinese: 如何将那种正宗的北京精华一代代承转下去呢？

sentences.english: The disciplined mem are inclined to line up for genuine menu.
sentences.chinese: 守纪律的人倾向于排队等候正宗菜肴。

sentences.english: Risking your vacation by eating authentic street food.
sentences.chinese: 度假时冒险去吃正宗路边摊。

sentences.english: We have local wild vegetables from Wuzhi Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我们店里有正宗的五指山野菜。

sentences.english: Authentic gong bao jiding should carry a little aroma of litchi . A little sweetness is a must.
sentences.chinese: 正宗的宫保鸡丁是带点荔枝味的，必须稍带甜味。

definition: to prepare (food etc) using a secret recipe
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
